name: Hotel Splendide
description: Upscale hotel in Royale-les-Eaux, featured in 'Casino Royale'.

content.title: Overview
content.body: Hotel Splendide is a fictional luxury hotel situated in the resort town of Royale-les-Eaux where much of the social interaction and intrigue occur in the novel. It caters to wealthy guests, including spies, gamblers, and diplomats.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: The hotel is characterized by its elegant architecture, plush interiors, and well-appointed rooms suitable for the elite clientele. It features grand lounges, private suites, and is often a meeting place for covert dealings.

content.title: History
content.body: Fleming places the hotel as a fixture of post-war European luxury leisure, reflecting the era's tourism resurgence. Within the narrative, its reputation is that of exclusivity and discretion, suited to the espionage activities it shelters.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The Hotel Splendide acts as a crucial setting for key plot points, including Bond’s interactions with other characters such as Vesper Lynd and René Mathis. It provides a location where tensions simmer beneath surface civility.
